thread.title: Galileo Launches Infrastructure Performance Management Webinar Series with Leading Analyst Firm
thread.title_full: Galileo Launches Infrastructure Performance Management Webinar Series with Leading Analyst Firm

author: Darren Behuniak
title: Galileo Launches Infrastructure Performance Management Webinar Series with Leading Analyst Firm
text:
Galileo, a division of ATS Group and developers of Galileo Performance Explorer® software, the industry's first cloud-based integrated infrastructure performance management (IPM) suite for servers, storage, and applications, will be hosting live quarterly webinars presented by industry analysts, product innovators, and Galileo software users. The series will share "from the trenches" advice, expertise, and direct experiences for managing business-critical responsibilities and optimizing infrastructure performance management. The webinars are free, 60-minute presentations for CIOs and IT professionals, whether current Galileo users or not. On a quarterly basis, webinars will include discussions by recognized industry experts and analysts, customer case studies, as well as occasional ‘lunch and learn’ formats for IT administrators addressing specific “how to” solve performance management issues.
The first webinar will be held on September 16 at 2:00pm EST, where Galileo is teaming with Taneja Group, a leading analyst and consulting group focused on storage, server, networking, and other infrastructure technologies, including Big Data and Cloud. Discussions will focus on a "from the trenches" executive overview presenting best practices and practical applications by Mike Matchett, Sr. Analyst and Consultant from Taneja, along with ATS Group / Galileo co-founders Chris Churchey and Tim Conley. It will focus on:
 How to better prevent system slowdowns How to troubleshoot problems faster in IT environments How to best size environments on-premise, cloud, or hybrid How to keep IT environments running optimally How to gain predictive operational insight into IT environments
“We know firsthand the constant pressure for IT teams to focus on larger, "more pressing" issues like cost-cutting, consolidation, outsourcing, research, and implementation of new technology for competitive advantage,” said Galileo principal and co-founder Chris Churchey. “We also know that it's easy for the common day-to-day performance and user experience headaches caused by any data center environment to be lost in the mix. With decades of experience and a large staff focused with clients on solving their infrastructure performance management issues, we can share not only the expertise provided by Galileo Performance Explorer, but we also raise industry respect for IT’s ability to support business growth.”
To attend, register online on the Galileo website. The one-hour webinar will also allow for questions from the audience. Registration for future sessions will be announced on the Galileo website .
About Galileo
Designed by systems engineers from real world implementations, Galileo Performance Explorer® is the industry’s first easy-to-use, cloud-based suite of integrated Infrastructure Performance Management (IPM) solutions with unified At a Glance Enterprise reporting and analytics dashboards. Galileo enables IT operational efficiency by consolidating monitoring, configuration and capacity planning capabilities into a single cost and time-saving suite for servers, storage, and applications. With a Software as a Service (SaaS) architecture and subscription pricing, installation is simple. Galileo’s deep analytics can save up to 80% in time and resources currently dedicated to infrastructure analysis versus legacy tools. Galileo supports all major server manufacturers, operating systems, Storage Area Networks (SAN) and IBM and NetApp storage systems.
